replies.body:
Because if people get perma banned. how will they be able to buy skins from riot?

It would turn players off from this game and their popularity would go down because people want to do whatever they please regardless of the consequences to those around them, as long as it is of no consequence to them self.

They wouldn't want to risk losing money due to a popularity drop, that would be bad business. So instead they end up with a popularity drop that is bad for business.

There are many players who are permabanned by Riot you know, Riot is not hesitant in using the hammer in cases they see fit. Especially on NA board, there is never a shortage of "I got falsely banned" threads, so much so there is this conspiracy theory flying around that alleges Riot intentionally bans paying players because they know they will always come back with a fresh account to pay more in order to get back the things they've lost from permaban. But of course, the claim's legitimacy is really up for question given that if that were to be true, and considering LoL's popularity and aversion (competitive or just bitter ones), it should've been on the headlines by now; so I doubt it but whatever.

Then again, community's narrative is rather indecisive, we're always trying to maintain both the claims that "Riot bans no one because $$$" and "Riot bans everyone because $$$", it just makes no sense. Which is it? Are either of them true in the first place?

Oh well.
